message.content:
cs.CG, cs.GR, cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.SG. 

The paper deals with the unfolding of convex polyhedra, which is a topic in computational geometry (cs.CG). The use of closed polygonal curves and cones suggests a connection to geometric representations (cs.GR). The paper also involves cutting and unfolding, which are common techniques in computational topology (cs.DS). The problem of unfolding a polyhedron can also be viewed as a graph theory problem, which falls under the category of graph algorithms (cs.GT). Finally, the paper's focus on planar polygons suggests a connection to computational geometry and topology in the context of surface meshes (cs.SG).
